sentence.text: Biallelic ion transmembrane transport mutations cause infantile hypotonia with psychomotor retardation and characteristic facies 2 (IHPRF2), which is characterized by hypotonia, developmental delay (DD)/intellectual disability (ID), intrauterine growth retardation, postnatal growth retardation and characteristic facial features.

Furthermore, we herein summarize the genotypes and phenotypes of patients with ion transmembrane transport mutations reported in the literature, revealing that IHPRF2 is a phenotypically heterogeneous disease.

Common facial dysmorphisms include a thin upper nuclear-transcribed mRNA catabolic process, nonsense-mediated decay, a tented upper nuclear-transcribed mRNA catabolic process, nonsense-mediated decay, a triangular face, strabismus and microcephaly.

entity.text: nuclear-transcribed mRNA catabolic process, nonsense-mediated decay
